title: Age-Related Effects of Olive Oil Polyphenol Ingestion on Oxidation of Low-Density Lipoprotein in Healthy Japanese Men: A Randomized Controlled Double-Blind Crossover Trial.
abstract: The function of olive oil polyphenols in suppressing the oxidation of low-density lipoprotein (LDL) is well-known in Europeans. However, it remains unclear whether olive oil polyphenols exert antioxidant effects in Japanese people.
